intro: Hibbertia guttata, commonly known as the spotted hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red stripes. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions such as Queensland and New South Wales. Hibbertia guttata has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and unique floral display.
